review: I also own a Roku 2 which I use on my boat. I use the Fire at home. They are similar and there are things I like and dislike about both. I like the search on Roku better. When you search a title it searches into the different apps and gives you a choice of which apps you prefer. As some charge for content and others offer the same content for free this is a huge advantage. Fire has the voice activated search which is nice but I seldom use it because it only searches Amazon content.  Another thing I dislike is how the preview screens are formatted. I generally cannot read the titles or other descriptions on the Fire as they are rendered too small.Like all of these streaming devices I wish they offered some sort of live news service. To the best of my knowledge none do.
author: Fparry

review: I received an email with special pricing for this and after researching, I decided to purchase the Fire TV.  It was easy to set up and finding movies/shows is easy too.  The voice search is extremely accurate but as others have said, it only searches the amazon library.  I'm on Verizon WiFi and I get no "buffering" pauses like i did when i used my Samsung home theater.  Has a nice picture and sound.  My only complaint is that i cant use "showtime anytime" because my TV provider is direcTV and they aren't on the list of service providers when setting up the app.  Not cool.Note:  When searching for a movie/show, be sure to look thru all the apps because you may have to purchase the show/movie on one app but it may be free on another app.
